speaker: Doctor
text: Good morning, Mr. Johnson. How have you been managing with your medications lately?

speaker: Patient
text: Morning, Doctor. I've been taking my metformin and tiotropium as prescribed, but my blood sugar levels have been a bit unpredictable.

speaker: Doctor
text: I see. Have you noticed any particular times when your blood sugar tends to spike or drop?

speaker: Patient
text: It seems to spike after meals, even though I'm trying to watch what I eat.

speaker: Doctor
text: We might need to adjust your metformin dose or consider adding another medication to help with those post-meal spikes. How are your COPD symptoms with the tiotropium?

speaker: Patient
text: The tiotropium helps, but I still get short of breath sometimes, especially when I'm active.
